net.hudup.listener

Class UserSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.listener.UserSession
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class UserSession
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    User session is used to store user information such as account name, password, and privileges on server in a session. In current implementation, it is used by delegators represented AbstractDelegator classes. This class has the internal variable userSession as a map. Each user information is stored as an entry in such map. Every entry is a pair of key and value.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • size

        public int size()
        Getting the size of this session.
        Returns:

      • get

        public java.lang.Object get(java.lang.String key)

        Returns:
        value the value (user information) associated with the specified key.

      • putAccount

        public void putAccount(java.lang.String account)
        Putting the account information into this session. The account information has the key DataConfig.ACCOUNT_NAME_FIELD and the value is the account name specified by the parameter. For example, the account "John" is stored as the entry ("account_name", "John") in which key is "account_name" and value is "John".
        Parameters:
        account - specified account name.

      • getAccount

        public java.lang.String getAccount()
        Getting the account (name). The account information has the key DataConfig.ACCOUNT_NAME_FIELD and the value is the account name. For example, the account "John" is stored as the entry ("account_name", "John") in which key is "account_name" and value is "John".
        Returns:
        account account (name).

      • putPassword

        public void putPassword(java.lang.String password)
        Putting user password into this session. The password information has the key DataConfig.ACCOUNT_PASSWORD_FIELD and the value is password specified by the parameter. For example, the password "secret" is stored as the entry ("account_password", "secret") in which key is "account_password" and value is "secret".
        Parameters:
        password - specified password.

      • getPassword

        public java.lang.String getPassword()
        Getting user password. The password information has the key DataConfig.ACCOUNT_PASSWORD_FIELD and the value is the password as text. For example, the password "secret" is stored as the entry ("account_password", "secret") in which key is "account_password" and value is "secret".
        Returns:
        password password as text.

      • putPriv

        public void putPriv(int priv)
        Putting user privileges into this session. The privileges information has the key DataConfig.ACCOUNT_PRIVILEGES_FIELD and the value is user privileges specified by the parameter. For example, the administration privilege "1" is stored as the entry ("account_privs", "1") in which key is "account_privs" and value is "1".
        Parameters:
        priv - specified user privileges as an integer.

      • getPriv

        public int getPriv()
        Getting user privileges. The privileges information has the key DataConfig.ACCOUNT_PRIVILEGES_FIELD and the value is user privileges as an integer. For example, the administration privilege "1" is stored as the entry ("account_privs", "1") in which key is "account_privs" and value is "1".
        Returns:
        privileges user privileges as an integer.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clearing this session, which means that all user information (all entries) is removed from this session.
